# Timeline

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| message: false
#| warning: false
#| fig.width: 10
#| fig.height: 8

library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(lubridate)

# Generate Dates
start_date <- as.Date("2026-01-01")
end_date <- as.Date("2026-05-31")
dates <- seq(start_date, end_date, by = "day")

# Identify Meeting Dates (Tuesdays and Thursday between Jan 13 and May 7)
meeting_start <- as.Date("2026-01-13")
meeting_end <- as.Date("2026-05-07")
is_meeting_range <- dates >= meeting_start & dates <= meeting_end
is_tue_thu <- wday(dates) %in% c(3, 5) # 3=Tue, 5=Thu
meeting_dates <- dates[is_meeting_range & is_tue_thu]

# Create Calendar Data Frame
cal_data <- data.frame(Date = dates) %>%
  mutate(
    Month = factor(format(Date, "%B"), levels = month.name),
    Day = day(Date),
    Wday = wday(Date, label = TRUE, abbr = TRUE),
    WeekOfYear = isoweek(Date),
    Year = year(Date)
  )

# Let's use a simpler "week index" for plotting y-axis
cal_data <- cal_data %>%
  group_by(Month) %>%
  mutate(WeekIndex = as.numeric(format(Date, "%U"))) %>%
  mutate(WeekIndex = WeekIndex - min(WeekIndex))

# Add Event Types
cal_data$Event <- NA
cal_data$Event[cal_data$Date %in% meeting_dates] <- "Meeting"
cal_data$Event[cal_data$Date == as.Date("2026-01-15")] <- "Kick-off"
cal_data$Event[cal_data$Date == as.Date("2026-05-07")] <- "Wrap-up"

# Plot
ggplot(cal_data %>% filter(Month %in% month.name[1:5]), aes(x = Wday, y = -WeekIndex, fill = Event)) +
  geom_tile(color = "white", size = 0.5) +
  geom_text(aes(label = Day), size = 3) +
  facet_wrap(~Month, ncol = 3, scales = "free_x") + # Free x not needed but keeps it clean
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("Meeting" = "#a6cee3", "Kick-off" = "#b2df8a", "Wrap-up" = "#fb9a99"), 
                    na.value = "grey95", 
                    name = "Schedule") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    axis.title = element_blank(),
    axis.text.y = element_blank(),
    axis.ticks = element_blank(),
    panel.grid = element_blank(),
    legend.position = "bottom"
  )
```
